member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.Mappings.RecommenderMappingExtensions.WithGeneratedNegativeData``6(MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.Mappings.IRecommenderMapping{``0,``1,``2,``3,``4,``5},System.Double)
member.summary: Chains a given recommender mapping with a mapping that augments the mapped data with negative examples, while treating all instances provided by the original mapping as positive.
member.typeparam: The type of a source of instances.
The type of a feature source.
The type of the feature values.
member.param: The mapping to chain with the negative data generator mapping.

The degree to which each element of the item histogram is raised before sampling. Should be different from 1.0 if it is believed that there is some quality bar which drives popular items to be more generally liked.

member.name: T:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.ColdUserItemParameterAlgorithm
member.summary: Represents a Matchbox recommender algorithm which infers the parameters of cold users and items.

member.name: F:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.ColdUserItemParameterAlgorithm.userFeatureParameterPosteriors
member.summary: The posteriors over the user feature related parameters learned during community training.

member.name: F:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.ColdUserItemParameterAlgorithm.itemFeatureParameterPosteriors
member.summary: The posteriors over the item feature related parameters learned during community training.

member.name: F:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.ColdUserItemParameterAlgorithm.userParameterDistributionAverage
member.summary: The prior distribution of a cold user excluding the effect of features. This is computed as the average from all training users.

member.name: F:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.ColdUserItemParameterAlgorithm.itemParameterDistributionAverage
member.summary: The prior distribution of a cold item excluding the effect of features. This is computed as the average from all training items.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The posteriors over the user feature related parameters learned during community training.
The posteriors over the item feature related parameters learned during community training.
The average trait, bias, and threshold posterior over all users in training.
The average trait and bias posterior over all items in training.

member.returns: A distribution over the user parameters.

member.param: The item features.
member.returns: A distribution over the item parameters.

member.name: T:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Models.User.MatchboxCommunityTraining_EP
member.summary: Generated algorithm for performing inference.
member.remarks:
If you wish to use this class directly, you must perform the following steps: 1) Create an instance of the class. 2) Set the value of any externally-set fields e.g. data, priors. 3) Call the Execute(numberOfIterations) method. 4) Use the XXXMarginal() methods to retrieve posterior marginals for different variables.
Generated by Infer.NET 2.6.41114.1 at 11:56 PM on Friday, November 14, 2014.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Models.User.MatchboxCommunityTraining_EP.Execute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing the given number of times
member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. If this is less than the number already done, message-passing is restarted from the beginning. Changing the observed values resets the iteration count to 0.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Models.User.MatchboxCommunityTraining_EP.Update(System.Int32)
member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing an additional number of times
member.param: The number of iterations that should be executed, starting from the current message state. Messages are not reset, even if observed values have changed.

member.name: T:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Models.User.MatchboxRatingPrediction_EP
member.summary: Generated algorithm for performing inference.
member.remarks:
If you wish to use this class directly, you must perform the following steps: 1) Create an instance of the class. 2) Set the value of any externally-set fields e.g. data, priors. 3) Call the Execute(numberOfIterations) method. 4) Use the XXXMarginal() methods to retrieve posterior marginals for different variables.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Models.User.MatchboxRatingPrediction_EP.Execute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing the given number of times
member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. If this is less than the number already done, message-passing is restarted from the beginning. Changing the observed values resets the iteration count to 0.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Models.User.MatchboxRatingPrediction_EP.Update(System.Int32)
member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing an additional number of times
member.param: The number of iterations that should be executed, starting from the current message state. Messages are not reset, even if observed values have changed.

member.name: T:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.Mappings.TrainTestSplittingRecommenderMapping`6
member.summary: Represents the data splitting mapping that can be wrapped around any other recommender mapping to split the underlying data into the training and test parts.
member.typeparam: The type of a source of instances.
The type of a feature source.
The type of the feature values.

list.listheader: The data splitting algorithm works as follows:

item.description: The requested fraction of items is removed from the consideration (thus, ignored) with all the associated observations.
The requested fraction of items is put into the test set (so called cold items) with all the associated observations.
The requested fraction of the users remaining after (1-2) is removed from consideration (thus, ignored) with all the associated observations.
The requested fraction of the users remaining after (1-2) is put into the test set (so called cold users) with all the associated observations.
The requested fraction of the users remaining after (1-2) is put into the training set with all the associated observations.

For each user remaining after (1-5) the requested fraction of observations is put into the training set, while the rest is put into the test set. At least one observation is always put into the training set for each user.

If requested, instances associated with the occasionally produced cold items are removed from the test set. An item is said to be "occasionally cold" if it is covered only by the test set but wasn't explicitly chosen as cold. Such items can be produced by the steps (4) and (6). This option is supposed to be used when the requested number of cold users and items is set to zero, in order to ensure that all the entities in the test set are covered by the training set.

member.name: T:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.Mappings.IMatchboxRecommenderMapping`2
member.summary:
A mapping used by the implementations of
interface to convert user data to an appropriate format.
member.typeparam: The type of a source of instances.
The type of a source of features.
member.remarks: Feature-related methods in this interface are only called when user of item features are being used. During training, features for all entities are required, and hence the methods called are the GetAll*Feature* ones. During prediction, features are requested on per-entity basis, and hence the GetSingle*Feature* methods are called. Note that entity features are expected not to change between training and prediction, and therefore only features of cold users or items will be requested during prediction.

member.param: The source of instances to get the user identifiers from.
The number of the current batch (used only if the data is divided into batches).
member.remarks: Note that this method can be called concurrently from multiple threads, so its implementation must be thread-safe.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.CommunityTrainingAlgorithm.ConstrainEntityParameters(MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.ParameterDistributions)
member.summary: Constrains the per-user and per-item model parameters.
member.param: The parameters to constrain to.
member.remarks: The per-entity parameters are constrained to their corresponding output messages (or more concretely, to the marginal divided by the prior). This is required in order to carry message information over several batches of the data.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.CommunityTrainingAlgorithm.InitializeEntityParameters(MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.ParameterDistributions)
member.summary: Initializes the per-user and per-item model parameters.
member.param: The parameters to initialize to.
member.remarks: The per-entity parameter initialization is required for correct reconstruction of the intermediate messages by the special first iteration. The initializers have to contain the corresponding posteriors from the last iteration. Note that feature-related parameters do not need to be initialized, because messages to the features are not reconstructed by the special first iteration.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderInternal.CommunityTrainingAlgorithm.InferParameters(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Infers the parameters of the Matchbox model.
member.param: Indicates whether user and item features should be inferred.
member.returns: Distributions over the parameters of the Matchbox model inferred from the data.
member.remarks: This method can be called only after all observed values in the model have been set.

member.name: M:MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.MatchboxRecommenderPredictionSettings.SetPredictionLossFunction(MicrosoftResearch.Infer.Learners.LossFunction,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Sets the loss function which determines how a prediction in the form of a distribution is converted into a point prediction.
member.param: The loss function.

An optional custom loss function. This can only be set when is set to 'Custom'. The custom loss function returns the loss incurred when choosing an estimate instead of the true value, where the first argument is the true value and the second argument is the estimate of the true value.

member.summary: Gets the loss function which determines how a prediction in the form of a distribution is converted into a point prediction.
member.param: The custom loss function on integers. This is null unless the returned is 'Custom'.
member.remarks: A loss function returns the loss incurred when choosing an estimate instead of the true value, where the first argument is the true value and the second argument is the estimate of the true value.
